Detector.Details: Finds usages of Guava Beta APIs.

BugPattern.LongDescription: Use of class {3}, which is annotated with Beta.
BugPattern.Details: Libraries should not use APIs annotated with Beta. From the Guava homepage: APIs marked with the @Beta annotation at the class or method level are subject to change. They can be modified in any way, or even removed, in any major release. If your code is a library itself (i.e. it is used on the CLASSPATH of users outside your own control), you should not use beta APIs, unless you repackage them (e.g. using ProGuard).
